fields.description:
Hi All,

Following is the topology:

Cloud-in-a-box
Network Mode: Managed-novlan

Following are the packages tested against:

{code}
euca2ools-3.1.0-0.0.169.20140410git72569c33.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-cloud-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-osg-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-imaging-toolkit-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-blockdev-utils-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-axis2c-common-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.4-0.194.140407git81659ff.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-debuginfo-4.0.0-0.0.887.20140416git649d95f1.el6.x86_64
{code}

Inside the instance the resolv.conf points to the CLC

{code}
[root@euca-172-16-112-76 ~]# cat /etc/resolv.conf 
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search eucalyptus.internal
nameserver 10.104.10.30
{code}

I am able to resolve names via nslookup

{code}
[root@euca-172-16-112-76 ~]# nslookup jeevanullas.in
Server:		10.104.10.30
Address:	10.104.10.30#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	jeevanullas.in
Address: 188.40.110.37
{code}

But SSH fails

{code}
[root@euca-172-16-112-76 ~]# ssh jeevanullas.in
ssh: Could not resolve hostname jeevanullas.in: Name or service not known
{code}

Hence I have to force the query type to be A instead of the default behaviour which the ssh client exhibits that is try with AAAA (this is the precedence most of the clients will have) and in case of no record try with A.

{code}
[root@euca-172-16-112-76 ~]# ssh -4 jeevanullas.in
The authenticity of host 'jeevanullas.in (188.40.110.37)' can't be established.
RSA key fingerprint is 93:3e:b6:30:fd:f0:3f:d2:fe:05:4e:a4:f6:30:b9:02.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)?
{code}

Client should work in their default configuration without user forcing the query type and the CLC DNS service should respond back with NOERROR instead of a SERVFAIL it does currently.

I could not test this with Edge mode because I am blocked with EUCA-9157 so this is only tested in MANAGED* modes.

Please let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: eucalyptus DNS should not return SERVFAIL for AAAA query types

comments.body: [~dshekhawat], Please submit a pull request based on your finding and fix. Thanks
[~dshekhawat] [~kedwards] Do you know if it ever worked? (bug or feature request?)
[~spark] based on EUCA-2329 it seems to have been fixed but the response back from CLC is SERVFAIL instead of NOERROR. I am not sure if this is a regression or EUCA-2329 missed the correct fix.
[~dshekhawat], can you add the failing test case here?
[~viglesias], please add the test case to the suite so we don't hit this one again.
It appears that dns service returns wrong answer to AAAA queries on external dns names (recursive). It returns NOERROR for the internal names.
[~dshekhawat] The issue was that the authority section was not added when the external query returns 0 answers for AAAA. Your analysis was very useful. thanks!

Thanks [~spark], it is working fine now with the following packages

{code}
# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-common-java-4.0.0-0.0.932.20140425git00ef0ef9.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.5-0.el6.noarch

eucalyptus-imaging-worker-image-1.0.0-0.147.140425git34ea9af.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.4-0.197.140422git81659ff.el6.x86_64
{code}
[~dshekhawat] Could you provide simplified steps to reproduce this issue?
[~spark] Could you provide simplified steps to verify this issue?

Hi [~mmunn1],

A simple test would be to run following command from within the instance

{code}
# host -t AAAA jeevanullas.in
{code}

This should give a message saying:

{code}
jeevanullas.in has no AAAA record
{code}

Earlier the same command would have returned {{NXDOMAIN}} error.

I am not sure if this gives a minimal test case for this issue but in general IMHO the CLC DNS server should be treated as a DNS server providing a DNS service and much broader set of DNS tests should be performed against it to confirm the implementation is as close as one can be to RFCs.

Hope the above makes sense if you have any questions please let us know.

Cheers!
Deependra

# host -t AAAA jeevanullas.in
jeevanullas.in has no AAAA record
